Description: Lower body and handle sherd of Attic black-figured pottery kantharos; interior glazed black; exterior: on lower body, black figure decoration with Hydra (only trace remaining); below, band of added red above a moulded fillet with band of single black dots on top; below fillet, broken maeander band; handle glazed black; on lower wall three bands above broad zone with staggered dots.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding shape, see British Museum 1914,0317.7. The sherd belongs to the same vase as Alexandria 9383.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 86 no. 290 b pl. 65)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 356-7, no. B458, pl. XXVI, pl. CLXXVIII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1242) (phase 3)
